text:
I am getting the following error in Julia 1.6.0 rc in a Zygote backwards pass. Shouldn't those types be compatible?
```TypeError: in typeassert, expected AbstractVector{var"#s828"} where var"#s828"<:Union{Nothing, Tuple{Any, NamedTuple{(:layers,), _A} where _A<:Tuple{Any}}}, got a value of type Vector{Union{Nothing, Tuple{Any, NamedTuple{(:layers,), T} where T<:Tuple}}}```

elements.text: I am getting the following error in Julia 1.6.0 rc in a Zygote backwards pass. Shouldn't those types be compatible?

TypeError: in typeassert, expected AbstractVector{var"#s828"} where var"#s828"<:Union{Nothing, Tuple{Any, NamedTuple{(:layers,), _A} where _A<:Tuple{Any}}}, got a value of type Vector{Union{Nothing, Tuple{Any, NamedTuple{(:layers,), T} where T<:Tuple}}}

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
`Tuple` is not a subtype of `Tuple{Any}` in the `NamedTuple`, so the judgement doesn't hold
